greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Leading digit of n expressed in base 3.
comment: Values 1 and 2 appear alternately and each time in runs whose lengths are the powers of 3. Each power of 3 is used twice: once for a run of 1's and then for a run of 2's.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: g(x) satisfies g(x) = x + 2 x^2 + (1+x+x^2) g(x^3). (End)
results.author: Peter C. Heinig (algorithms(AT)gmx.de), Oct 20 2006
ext: Name changed by _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Sep 29 2011
